H0.text: what other countries border argentina. Brazil

H1.text: what other countries border argentina. Uruguay

H2.text: what other countries border argentina. Paraguay

H3.text: what other countries border argentina. Chile

A4.text: Argentina is located in southern South America, sharing land borders with Chile across the Andes to the west; Bolivia and Paraguay to the north; Brazil to the northeast, Uruguay and the South Atlantic Ocean to the east; and the Drake Passage to the south; for an overall land border length of 9,376 km (5,826 mi).

A5.text: Argentina shares the bulk of the Southern Cone with Chile to the west, and is also bordered by Bolivia and Paraguay to the north, Brazil to the northeast, Uruguay and the South Atlantic Ocean to the east.

A6.text: Its largest and the world's second largest international land border is with Chile, which is 5,308 km (3,298 mi) long.

A7.text: The Argentina–Paraguay border is 1,699 km (1,056 mi) long.

A8.text: The Argentina–Brazil border is approximately 1,224 km (761 mi) long.

A9.text: It was defined by the Treaty of 1898 (which is based on an Arbitration Award 1895), referred by President of the United States Grover Cleveland, and is perfectly demarcated.
